answerText: Sweeney (the works mentioned are "Sweeney Among the Nightingales" and Sweeney Agonistes)[10] This poet who described "an alien people clutching their gods" in "The Journey Of The Magi" and wrote of an "old man in a dry month" in "Gerontion" penned poems featuring Sweeney "Erect" and "Among the Nightingales."
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Editors 3 | 16 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question:  [10] Give this name shared by an "apeneck" prostitute enthusiast who in another author's poem flees "the lady in the cape" and Rachel Rabinovitch after suspecting that they intend to kill him. An unfinished play is titled for this character "Agonistes."
